intro: Dendromecon brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandeggea tree, is a member of the Papaveraceae family, native to the western United States. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Dendromecon brandegeei is adapted to arid environments and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats.
